description: This armbar technique is executed from a seated guard position when the opponent is attempting a guard pass, specifically a Toreando pass. It leverages a collar grip and a quick hip switch to surprise the opponent by transitioning directly into an armbar submission without a typical setup.

sequential_diagram_steps.label: Initial Collar Grip Setup
sequential_diagram_steps.detail: Start seated, maintaining a strong collar grip while the opponent attempts a Toreando guard pass and grips your pants.

sequential_diagram_steps.label: Hip Switch and Leg Placement
sequential_diagram_steps.detail: Slide your free foot (opposite the collar grip) to the opponent's hip, simultaneously switching your own hips to create an angle for the arm attack.

sequential_diagram_steps.label: Dynamic Roll and Arm Isolation
sequential_diagram_steps.detail: Roll backward dynamically, bringing your leg over the opponent's head to isolate their arm while maintaining the collar grip.

sequential_diagram_steps.label: Secure and Finish Armbar
sequential_diagram_steps.detail: Catch the opponent's triceps, break their grip by kicking, and secure the straight armbar by closing your elbow and pressing your knee against their trapped elbow.
